newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU mergers and takeovers -- (UPDATED MAY 23).
newsitem.headline: EU mergers and takeovers -- (UPDATED MAY 23).

text.p: The following are additions and deletions to the list of takeovers, mergers and joint ventures being reviewed by the European Commission under the European Union's merger regulation (*). The Commission has a month to clear or start a detailed, four-month probe after a deal has been filed.
** ADDITIONS **
-- Siebe Plc's proposed takeover of the whole of APV Plc (Notified May 14)

-- Proposal by the French Mulliez family, which partly owns supermarket chain Auchan, and Italian group IFI to jointly control the whole of their retail and do-it-yourself activities in Italy by creating two joint ventures (Notified May 13)
** DELETIONS **

-- Warner Bros.' International Theaters, a unit of Time Warner, Portuguese media group Lusomundo and Spanish pay-TV firm Sogecable, partly owned by Canal Plus CNLP.PA), cinema joint venture in Spain. (Cleared May 16).
** ON-GOING ONE-MONTH REVIEWS **

-- Proposed joint venture between Vallourec's VLLP.PA Valinox Welded SA and Titanium Metals, which is controlled by Tremont, to hold and operate the welded tubing businesses of both companies (Notified May 6)
-- Austrian PTT unit PTA and Italy's STET Mobile Holding proposed joint control of Austrian mobile phone firm Mobilkom (Notified May 5)
-- Swiss chemicals company Clariant AG proposed buy of Hoechst's speciality chemicals unit Virteon GmbH (Notified May 2)
-- Proposed merger of Lyonnaise des Eaux and Compagnie de Suez (Notified April 30)
-- U.S. Tyco Intl. control of rival Bermuda-based electronic security firm ADT Ltd (Notified April 25).
-- Mannesmann's Mannesmannroehren-Werke control of steelmaker Vallourec (Notified April 25).
-- German diversified utility VIAG AG acquisition of control of chemicals firm Th.Goldschmidt AG from Ruetgers AG and insurer Allianz Versicherungs AG (Notified April 23).
-- South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co control of U.S. personal computer and electronics firm AST Research Inc. (Notified April 22).
-- Deutsche Bank and German building firm Hochtief AG joint control of building rival Holzmann AG. (Notified April 15. German Cartel Office requested jurisdiction -- deadline extended to June 3).
** DETAILED REVIEWS **
-- Nordic soft drinks joint venture of Coca-Cola and Carlsberg A/S of Denmark. (Full probe opened May 2).
-- Boeing Co acquisition of McDonnell Douglas. (Full probe opened March 19).
-- Dutch toy maker Blokker Holding BV takeover of Dutch operations of Toys "R" Us. (Full probe opened February 25).

(*) Commission has exclusive EU competence in corporate concentrations involving firms with a combined global turnover of 5.0 billion ecus and EU turnover of 250 million ecus each. It has the power to block, or force changes to, deals which create or strengthen dominant positions in the EU whether or not the companies involved are European.
